movies.title: 12 Years a Slave
movies.plot: In the pre-Civil War United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery. Facing cruelty as well as unexpected kindnesses Solomon struggles not only to stay alive, but to retain his dignity. In the twelfth year of his unforgettable odyssey, Solomonâ€™s chance meeting with a Canadian abolitionist will forever alter his life.

movies.title: Gone Girl
movies.plot: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.
movies.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 64 wins & 183 nominations.

events.title: Amy Elliott meets Nick Dunne at a party
Nick Dunne and Amy Elliott get engaged

movies.title: True Story
movies.plot: A drama centered around the relationship between journalist Michael Finkel and Christian Longo, an FBI Most Wanted List murderer who for years lived outside the U.S. under Finkel's name.

events.title: Christian Longo is sentenced to death

movies.title: Fantastic Mr. Fox
movies.plot: The Fantastic Mr. Fox bored with his current life, plans a heist against the three local farmers. The farmers, tired of sharing their chickens with the sly fox, seek revenge against him and his family.
movies.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 32 wins & 61 nominations.

events.title: Mr. Fox announces he wants a new house

movies.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
movies.plot: Singer Freddie Mercury, guitarist Brian May, drummer Roger Taylor and bass guitarist John Deacon take the music world by storm when they form the rock 'n' roll band Queen in 1970. Hit songs become instant classics. When Mercury's increasingly wild lifestyle starts to spiral out of control, Queen soon faces its greatest challenge yet â€“ finding a way to keep the band together amid the success and excess.

events.title: Queen play at the Live Aid concert

movies.title: JFK
movies.plot: This acclaimed Oliver Stone drama presents the investigation into the assassination of President John F. Kennedy led by New Orleans district attorney Jim Garrison. When Garrison begins to doubt conventional thinking on the murder, he faces government resistance, and, after the killing of suspected assassin Lee Harvey Oswald, he closes the case. Later, however, Garrison reopens the investigation, finding evidence of an extensive conspiracy behind Kennedy's death.
